ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Udāyī was skilled in archery. And because he disliked crows,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.3_0: he shot them. He cut off their heads and then set them out in a row impaled on stakes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.6_0: “Reverend, I am going to the monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.8_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.9_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī intentionally kill living beings?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.10_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.13_0: “... Foolish man, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.15_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.16.1_0: ‘If a monk intentionally kills a living being, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.6_0: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, he transgresses.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.8_0: the animal is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.9_0: The life of a living being executed:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.10_0: if he cuts off and makes an end of the life faculty, if he destroys its continuity, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.1_0: If it is a living being, and he perceives it as such, and he kills it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.2_0: If it is a living being, but he is unsure of it, and he kills it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.3_0: If it is a living being, but he does not perceive it as such, and he kills it, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.4_0: If it is not a living being, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.5_0: If it is not a living being, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.6_0: If it is not a living being, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.3_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.5_0: if he is not aiming at death;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.7_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.8_0: The first rule, the training rule on intentionally, is finished.
